questionListItems.title: Is there any ex-student visiting their teachers?

answer.body:
[Update] The school premises will be used during 2023 Presidential Election.

Hence, as a vital aspect of the meticulous preparations for this event, former students will regrettably be unable to partake in the customary tradition of visiting the teachers during the Teachers' Day Celebration on Thursday, 31 August, 2023.

Phase 2C will be open for registration on 1 Aug 2023. For more information, please visit MOE’s P1 registration website at https://www.moe.gov.sg/primary/p1-registration/registration-phases-key-dates?pt=2C.

questionListItems.title: Can I apply student care in the mid year in 2024?

answer.body: Yes, applications to our Student Care Centre can be made throughout the year. However, students are admitted subject to vacancy. Contact details of our Student Care Centre is available at the following website: https://www.princesselizabethpri.moe.edu.sg/general-information/School-Services/big-heart-student-care.

questionListItems.title: May I know if I can still be a parent volunteer for child born in 2018, registering for P1 in 2024?

answer.body: We are sorry to inform you that application for Parent Volunteer Scheme for P1 Registration for children born in 2018 has closed.

questionListItems.title: May we know when the schedule for the orientation will be confirmed? Our preschool is currently having their graduation day on the same day 4th November this we would like to align this with the preschool. Thank you!

answer.body: We are currently working on the programme for the P1 Orientation 2023, which would likely be from 8.30 am to 10.30 am on 4 November 2023 (Saturday). More details will be shared with the parents nearer the date.

questionListItems.title: when will the parents volunteer application open for child born in June 2020

answer.body: Phase 2B Parents Volunteer application for parents with children born between 2 January 2020 and 1 January 2021 (both dates inclusive) will be opened around end 2024/early 2025.

questionListItems.title: When is the P1 Orientation for 2023 and what if my child are unable to attend

answer.body: P1 Orientation 2023 will be held on 4 November 2023 (Saturday). The school will follow up with those who are unable to attend separately.

questionListItems.title: What are the parent volunteer scope that the school is looking for?

answer.body: There is no fixed scope of work defined for our selected Parent Volunteers. Besides helping with regular school activities/programmes, some of our Parent Volunteers are also involved in conducting activities/programmes for our students and staff based on their special talent areas and interests.

questionListItems.title:
Dear Team, 
Do direct me to the link or portal for me to the documents for Yet-To-Be-Ready HDB flat for my son whom I have applied for under Phase 2C.

answer.body: You may wish to visit HDB portal at https://services2.hdb.gov.sg/web/bp28/TimeLine/my-flat-dashboard to retrieve documents for Yet-To-Be-Ready HDB flats. The documents can then be submitted to the school via email at peps@schools.gov.sg.

questionListItems.title: my husband and I are looking into applying for our son primary 1 here. however we stay >2km away. we are planning to buy a house that's nearby in the near future. will we be able to secure a slot for our son?

answer.body: Thank you for your interest in Princess Elizabeth Primary School. Only registrants with an older sibling currently studying in the school are guaranteed a place in the school under Phase 1A of the P1 Registration Exercise. Registration for all other phases is subject to vacancies. Should there be more registrants than vacancies, ballot will be required.  Priority admission will be given based on your child's citizenship and the Home-School Distance category. For more information on P1 Registration, you may wish to visit MOE’s website: https://www.moe.gov.sg/primary/p1-registration

questionListItems.title: When will the parent volunteer registration for children born in year 2019 be open?

answer.body: Thank you for your interest in Princess Elizabeth Primary School’s Parent Volunteer Scheme. The application for children born in the year 2019 will be opened in Dec 2023/Jan 2024.

questionListItems.title: Since the PEPS Alumni Association will not be taking in any membership application at this point. How can the child of parent who is a former student of PEPS to be eligible for registration and enrollment for Phase 2A?

answer.body:
You may wish to note that for P1 registration exercise, a parent who is a former student of the primary school and a parent who have joined the alumni association of the primary school as a member would both qualify for Phase 2A registration.


For more information on Phase 2A registration, please refer to  https://www.moe.gov.sg/primary/p1-registration/how%20to%20register?pt=2A.

questionListItems.title: Current phase 2A balloting for which category (SC<1km/SC 1-2km..etc)?

answer.body: For the current Phase 2A balloting for Princess Elizabeth Primary School, balloting will be conducted for Singapore Citizen children residing within 1km of the school. For more information on vacancies and balloting updates for the 2023 P1 Registration, you may wish to visit MOE website: https://www.moe.gov.sg/primary/p1-registration/vacancies-and-balloting/

questionListItems.title: When can we i register for 2A

answer.body: Phase 2A will be open for registration on Wednesday, 12 July 2023. For more information, please visit MOE’s P1 registration website https://www.moe.gov.sg/primary/p1-registration/registration-phases-key-dates?pt=2A.

questionListItems.title: How do I arrange for my P2 son for school bus?

answer.body: For application for school bus service, please visit the following website https://www.princesselizabethpri.moe.edu.sg/general-information/School-Services/school-bus-service for the details of the contact person in charge.
